name: constmap
params: class c0, class c1, class c2
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)))

stmt.origin: sylibr(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))
-| wb(wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)))
-| wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))
-| wb(wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)))
-| wb(wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)), wf(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), c2, c1))
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(cxp(c2, csn(c0)), co(c1, cmap, c2)))
-| wcel(c1, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)

comment: A constant (represented without dummy variables) is an element of a function set. _Note: In the following development, we will be quite often quantifying over functions and points in N-dimensional space (which are equivalent to functions from an "index set"). Many of the following theorems exist to transfer standard facts about functions to elements of function sets._ (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Aug-2014.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 5-May-2015.)
